items.text: looks for the drive through cover again, but Shakib manages to get the flighted delivery outside off to dip sharply enough to mess with those plans
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Rayudu, no run

items.text: back of a length on off stump, Rohit glides it to point
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Sharma, no run

items.text: stays well-balanced at the crease as he flicks a short ball on middle to deep midwicket
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Sharma, 1 run

items.text: shuffles across on off stump to try and find  some runs at long leg - he does but it doesn't come off the bat
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Rayudu, 1 leg bye

items.text: soft hands as Rohit defends a slower ball on off stump. Looks for a single, but Rayudu isn't so keen
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Sharma, no run

items.text: hammers it to the sweeper cover, standing tall over the short ball and cutting it away like a boss
items.postText: Anil: "Commentator today here is not in good mood today probably. Or people are taking less interest than most other days. Comments published today are significantly less than other days" Bring your research. Let's compare notes.
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Sharma, 1 run

items.text: width again and an under-pressure batsman is able to secure an easy single to third man
items.postText: AtulJam: "Just a thought: Rohit should have treated this target as 300+ and India are 5 down at the end of 25 overs by sending India's middle and lower order to to handle the pressure!!! Just a Newtonian mind here..." He can never live up to all our expectations, can he?
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Rayudu, 1 run

items.text: flighted on off stump, he drives to long-on
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Rayudu, 1 run

items.text: the trajectory being flatter fools Rohit as he stays stuck in the crease against a pretty full ball on middle. But his lovely hands are able to adjust nicely and he pokes the ball to cover
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Sharma, no run

items.text: good length on off stump, defends
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Sharma, no run

items.text: that's brutal and it's fifty as well! Loud applause from the Dubai crowd as they watch Rohit Sharma pummel a one over deep midwicket. And what's more, it isn't even a short ball. Just a sharp eye and great hands
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Sharma, SIX runs

items.text: full on leg stump, defends
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Sharma, no run

items.text: pulls the pace back and adds an extra layer of flight, Rohit eases it through the covers
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Sharma, 1 run

items.text: hits on the up but can't beat cover
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Sharma, no run

items.text: beats him with a pitched up delivery that holds its line and makes Rohit's drive on the up look extremely ambitious
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Sharma, no run

items.text: gets an inside edge as he tries to force a short ball through the off side
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Sharma, no run

items.text: slower ball, which Rohit adjusts to in the end, and finds a single at point
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Sharma, 1 run

items.text: fuller delivery on off stump, defends to point
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Rayudu, no run

items.text: appeal for caught behind but umpire Brathwaite shakes his head. Mushfiqur Rahim is absolutely convinced though and he insists on the review. Replays indicate a noise as ball passes bat - and it's a beauty too, hitting the deck, cutting in off the seam. Rayudu plays with an angled bat, away from his body and in all likelihood he's nicked it through to the keeper. Yep, confirmation arrives via a spike on Snicko and he's out
items.postText: AJ: "This has been a high quality inning from Rohit. Not just he has scored a half century with a good strike rate. His control %age is 96%, which is phenomenal considering other batsmen have struggled. "
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Rayudu, OUT

dismissal.text: AT Rayudu c †Mushfiqur Rahim b Rubel Hossain 13 (28b 1x4 0x6) SR: 46.42

items.text: stands tall behind a good length ball on off stump and punches to long-off.
items.postText: That brings crowd favourite MSD on strike
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Sharma, 1 run

items.preText: KP: "Somebody from cricinfo team should should write a thesis paper on Hit-Man's six hitting prowess.Not Gaylish height,neither Baz's muscle...Still swivelling it over cow corner! please do the Phd..." It's not quite good enough for a PhD, but here's something
items.text: steps down the pitch immediately and plops the length ball outside off back at Shakib
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Dhoni, no run

items.text: earns a short ball - which was all he wanted when he went down the track first ball - and whips it away to deep midwicket
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Dhoni, 3 runs

items.text: launches it over deep midwicket - and then spies the bottom of his bat! Really, Rohit! This is a poor ball - slow, short and hit me written all over it. So Rohit rocks back and gives it all he has
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Sharma, SIX runs

items.text: slider, finding Rohit's inside edge as he defends in front of off stump
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Sharma, no run

items.text: pops up as Rohit looks to drive through the covers. Seems like the good length ball has held in the pitch and turned enough to induce a false shot.
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Sharma, 1 run
